title: Confirmatory (Residence) visa (subclass 808)
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== ​This visa is closed to new applications. Confirmatory (Residence) visa (subclass 808) Page Content ​​​​​​​​The Confirmatory (Residence) visa (subclass 808) is closed to new applications from 6 February 2025.​ ​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​ Explore your visa options .​ Visa holders Details This information is for people who already have been granted a Confirmatory (Residence) visa (subclass 808). It explains your rights and obligations. To check your visa details and entitlements use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) What this visa lets you do Details Stay in Australia indefinitely as a permanent resident Work and study in Australia Enrol in Australia’s public health care scheme Sponsor your relatives to come to Australia Travel to and from Australia while the travel facility on your visa is valid Apply for Australian citizenship, if eligible How long your visa lasts and travelling overseas as a permanent resident Details This visa allows you to stay in Australia indefinitely as a permanent resident. You can travel to and from Australia as many times as you want for 5 years from the date we grant this visa. This is as long as the travel facility on this visa remains valid. If you want to travel after the 5 year travel facility expires on your visa you: must apply for and be granted a Resident Return Visa (RRV) . This will allow you to re-enter Australia as a permanent resident should consider applying for Australian Citizenship. If you become an Australian Citizen, you do not require a visa to enter Australia. You can then apply for an Australian passport and use it to leave and re-enter Australia. Learn how to become an Australian citizen. See more information about travelling overseas as a permanent resident New Zealand passport holders Details If an immigration officer processes your clearance at our border, tell them you: have a permanent Australian visa do not want a Special Category visa (subclass 444). If you do not tell them, they may grant you a subclass 444 visa. This will override your permanent visa. It may also affect your eligibility for another permanent visa and/or Australian citizenship. Your obligations Details You must obey all Australian laws. Tell us if things change Details Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include: changes to your phone number, email, address the birth of a child when you get a new passport. See how to let us know if there is a change in your situation If you do not give us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport. Proving you have a visa Details To check your visa details and entitlements use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) You can also use VEVO to send proof of your visa conditions to others including: employers landlords the government of a country you would like to visit. Working Details You are protected by Australian workplace law. See your workplace rights and entitlements Bringing a family member Details As an Australian permanent resident, you might be able to sponsor eligible family members to come to Australia. To find a visa for your family member, explore visa options Becoming a Australian citizen Details After a certain time, you might be eligible for Australian citizenship. Learn more about becoming an Australian citizen For citizenship purposes, your permanent residency starts on either the day your visa was granted if you were in Australia, or the day you first entered Australia on this visa after it was granted.

===== main placeholder ==========================================

​This visa is closed to new applications.

​This visa is closed to new applications.

​This visa is closed to new applications.

# Confirmatory (Residence) visa (subclass 808)

Confirmatory (Residence) visa (subclass 808)
Page Content

​​​​​​​​The Confirmatory (Residence) visa (subclass 808) is closed to new applications from 6 February 2025.​

​​​​​​​​The Confirmatory (Residence) visa (subclass 808) is closed to new applications from 6 February 2025.​

​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​Explore your visa options.​

​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​
Explore your visa options
.​

## Visa holders

Visa holders
Details

This information is for people who already have been granted a Confirmatory (Residence) visa (subclass 808). It explains your rights and obligations.

This information is for people who already have been granted a Confirmatory (Residence) visa (subclass 808). It explains your rights and obligations.

To check your visa details and entitlements useVisa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO).

To check your visa details and entitlements use
Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)
.

### What this visa lets you do

What this visa lets you do
Details
- Stay in Australia indefinitely as a permanent resident
Stay in Australia indefinitely as a permanent resident
- Work and study in Australia
Work and study in Australia
- Enrol in Australia’s public health care scheme
Enrol in Australia’s public health care scheme
- Sponsor your relatives to come to Australia
Sponsor your relatives to come to Australia
- Travel to and from Australia while the travel facility on your visa is valid
Travel to and from Australia while the travel facility on your visa is valid
- Apply for Australian citizenship, if eligible
Apply for Australian citizenship, if eligible

### How long your visa lasts and travelling overseas as a permanent resident

How long your visa lasts and travelling overseas as a permanent resident
Details

This visa allows you to stay in Australia indefinitely as a permanent resident.

This visa allows you to stay in Australia indefinitely as a permanent resident.

You can travel to and from Australia as many times as you want for 5 years from the date we grant this visa. This is as long as the travel facility on this visa remains valid.

You can travel to and from Australia as many times as you want for 5 years from the date we grant this visa. This is as long as the travel facility on this visa remains valid.

If you want to travel after the 5 year travel facility expires on your visa you:

If you want to travel after the 5 year travel facility expires on your visa you:
- must apply for and be granted aResident Return Visa (RRV). This will allow you to re-enter Australia as a permanent resident
must apply for and be granted a
Resident Return Visa (RRV)
. This will allow you to re-enter Australia as a permanent resident
- should consider applying for Australian Citizenship. If you become an Australian Citizen, you do not require a visa to enter Australia. You can then apply for an Australian passport and use it to leave and re-enter Australia. Learn how tobecome an Australian citizen.
should consider applying for Australian Citizenship. If you become an Australian Citizen, you do not require a visa to enter Australia. You can then apply for an Australian passport and use it to leave and re-enter Australia. Learn how to
become an Australian citizen.

See more information abouttravelling overseas as a permanent resident.

See more information about
travelling overseas as a permanent resident
.

### New Zealand passport holders

New Zealand passport holders
Details

If an immigration officer processes your clearance at our border, tell them you:

If an immigration officer processes your clearance at our border, tell them you:
- have a permanent Australian visa
have a permanent Australian visa
- do not want a Special Category visa (subclass 444).
do not want a Special Category visa (subclass 444).

If you do not tell them, they may grant you a subclass 444 visa. This will override your permanent visa. It may also affect your eligibility for another permanent visa and/or Australian citizenship.

If you do not tell them, they may grant you a subclass 444 visa. This will override your permanent visa. It may also affect your eligibility for another permanent visa and/or Australian citizenship.

### Your obligations

Your obligations
Details

You must obey all Australian laws.

You must obey all Australian laws.

### Tell us if things change

Tell us if things change
Details

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:
- changes to your phone number, email, address
changes to your phone number, email, address
- the birth of a child
the birth of a child
- when you get a new passport.
when you get a new passport.

See how to let us know if there is achange in your situation.

See how to let us know if there is a
change in your situation
.

If you do not give us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport.

If you do not give us with the details of any new passport issued to you, you could experience significant delays at the airport.

### Proving you have a visa

Proving you have a visa
Details

To check your visa details and entitlements useVisa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO).

To check your visa details and entitlements use
Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)
.

You can also use VEVO to send proof of your visa conditions to others including:

You can also use VEVO to send proof of your visa conditions to others including:
- employers
employers
- landlords
landlords
- the government of a country you would like to visit.
the government of a country you would like to visit.

### Working

Working
Details

You are protected by Australian workplace law. See yourworkplace rights and entitlements.

You are protected by Australian workplace law. See your
workplace rights and entitlements
.

### Bringing a family member

Bringing a family member
Details

As an Australian permanent resident, you might be able to sponsor eligible family members to come to Australia.

As an Australian permanent resident, you might be able to sponsor eligible family members to come to Australia.

To find a visa for your family member,explore visa options.

To find a visa for your family member,
explore visa options
.

### Becoming a Australian citizen

Becoming a Australian citizen
Details

After a certain time, you might be eligible for Australian citizenship. Learn more aboutbecoming an Australian citizen.

After a certain time, you might be eligible for Australian citizenship. Learn more about
becoming an Australian citizen
.

For citizenship purposes, your permanent residency starts on either the day your visa was granted if you were in Australia, or the day you first entered Australia on this visa after it was granted.

For citizenship purposes, your permanent residency starts on either the day your visa was granted if you were in Australia, or the day you first entered Australia on this visa after it was granted.
